title: backup
content:
Help Manual for the Backup and Restore Screen

This screen allows users to create backups of their data, schedule automated backups, and restore a database from a previous backup.

Main Actions:

Create Backup Button:

This button allows you to create a backup of the current database immediately.

Steps:

  1. Click the Create Backup button.
  2. Wait for confirmation that the backup has been successfully created.

Close Schedule Form Button:

Clicking this button hides or closes the scheduling form for automated backups. This is useful if you do not wish to schedule a backup at this time.

Schedule Backup Form:

This form allows users to set up automatic backups at a specified frequency and time.

Steps:

  1. Frequency Dropdown: Select the desired frequency for the backups (e.g., daily, weekly).
  2. Time Field: Select the specific time for the backup to be executed.
  3. Click the Schedule Backup button to save the schedule.

Restore Database Button:

Clicking this button restores the database from the most recent backup.

Steps:

  1. Click the Restore Database button.
  2. Confirm the restoration when prompted (optional).

Common Issues and Solutions:

Error during Backup Creation:

If an error occurs when creating a backup, ensure that:

  • The database is available.
  • You have sufficient storage space.
  • Check the system logs for more detailed error messages.

Scheduling Backups:

Ensure you choose both a frequency and a valid time before scheduling. The 'Schedule Backup' button will be enabled only when valid options are selected.

Restore Process:

Restoring a database may overwrite the current database. Ensure you have the correct backup selected before proceeding with a restore.
